de.fau.amos

Class SQL

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.fau.amos.SQL

  • public class SQL
extends java.lang.Object
    SQL.java is an important class, which handles the PostgreSQL database requests. It builds up the connection to the chosen database and is able to add new tables (respectively to show/change/delete).

      if the committed columns and their values exist; new columns and their values will be added to the table "tableName" in the database
      static void createTable(java.lang.String tableName, java.lang.String[] columns)
      creates a new table "tableName" with several chosen columns "String[] columns" in the database
      static void execute(java.lang.String command)
      Executes Postrgresql Command without response.
      static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getColumns(java.lang.String tableName)
      adds column names from required database table "tableName" to ArrayList
      static java.lang.String getValueOfFieldWithId(java.lang.String tableName, java.lang.String column, java.lang.String id)
      shows the columns from the required table "tableName" with its ID "id"
      static java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>> query(java.lang.String command)
      Fills up an ArrayList> with the data of the SQL query (passed by the parameter)
      static java.sql.ResultSet queryToResultSet(java.lang.String command)
      Queries Postgresql command and returns result in a ResultSet Object.
